p: Researchers who previously assessed the viability of HEPG2 cells and ETBr cells treated with CET found that CET is not cytotoxic and whereas they induced dose-dependent anti-HBV and anti-bovine viral diarrhoea virus (BVDV) as a surrogate for HCV effects, respectively [ 16]. Our results also demonstrated that CET possesses low cytotoxicity and does not affect cell viability ( Fig. 2A). Moreover, viral RNA levels, protein expression levels, and viral titers ( Fig. 2B, C, and 2D) in CET-treated Vero cells revealed that 20–80 μM CET led to >50–90% virus inhibition, consistent with previous findings.
